current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Expressing the sense of the Senate on maintaining the current annual adjustment in retired pay for members of the Armed Forces under the age of 62.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That it is the sense of the
retirees from the Armed Forces should not unfairly bear the burden of excessive government spending;
military retirees earned the benefits they were promised upon entering the military, and it is the duty of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: should seek alternatives to the provisions of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 403 of the Bipartisan Budget Act of 2013

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: ) before the effective date of that section and the amendments made by that section.

text.#text: Whereas it  is the responsibility of Congress to get the fiscal house of government in order, and all government spending should be examined to achieve that goal;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a bipartisan budget proposal, is a first step in this direction, though it fails to address broader government spending issues;

text.#text: Whereas retirees from the Armed Forces, both those who served a full career and those medically retired and their survivors, have provided great service and sacrificed much for our country;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: disproportionally targets these military  retirees in the name of fiscal responsibility; and

text.#text: Whereas, while the decisions regarding future spending cuts may be difficult and painful, the solution should require contributions from all Americans: Now, therefore, be it

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 323 IS: Expressing the sense of the Senate on maintaining the current annual adjustment in retired pay for members of the Armed Forces under the age of 62.
